title: Drawing, Minerva, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza, 1787–1802
title_raw: Minerva, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza
medium: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash over black chalk on laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Minerva stands beneath trees having left foot upon base of pedestal, upon which pitcher rests. She holds snake which drinks from bowl held in her left hand. Inscription: minerva pacifica.  At right, Themis seated upon thrown, decorated with fasces.  She holds pair of scales and sword. Opened book leans against wall of domed circular hall, at left. Inscription: temi giostisia.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Minerva, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza, 1787–1802. Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash over black chalk on laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3434
